venue.name: Adams Mill Restaurant Upstairs Pub

item.description:
*** Weather update on 7/29/09: All the thunderstorms will clear out by 3 PM with conditions for the hike being sunny to partly cloudy, 81F, 69% humidity. I'll keep an eye on river water levels and may have to alter the hike path accordingly. ***

An after work social hike of about 2 miles in a hidden space that makes you feel miles outside of the city. The Adams Mill Trail loop starts to left of the restaurant (Adams Mill), follows along a dike to the Hockanum River, up the river to a railroad trestle, across the trestle to steps, and downstream on Eighth Utilities property along the river to Adams Street, along sidewalk back to parking lot.

On return trip, a little difficult in places due to erosion of the trail, narrow ledges in spots. Beautiful deep hemlock and pine forest, scenic sandstone gorge, view old mill and dam.

Park at Adams Mill restaurant, 165 Adams Street, Manchester, CT towards the left of the main building:
http://www.mapquest.c....

Kevin S (http://hiking.meetup....) is leading on this one so please direct questions to him.

group.name: The Hartford Area Hikingâ„¢ Meetup Group

item.name: Hike at the Adams Mill Trail in Manchester CT
